title-part.text: by precision casting, e.g. microfusing or investment casting
Building or constructing in particular ways
in a modular way, e.g. using several identical or complementary parts or features
using existing or "off the shelf" parts, e.g. using standardized turbocharger elements
by integrally manufacturing a component, e.g. by milling from a billet or one piece construction

for adjusting the position or the alignment, e.g. wedges or eccenters

note.note-paragraph: Components are the basic elements of construction

related to the trailing edge of a stator vane

related to the suction side of a stator vane

Cascades, i.e. assemblies of similar profiles acting in parallel
Casings or housings protecting or supporting assemblies within
Characteristics of rotor blades, i.e. of any element transforming dynamic fluid energy to or from rotational energy and being attached to a rotor
characteristics related to shock waves, transonic or supersonic flow
related to the leading edge of a rotor blade
related to the trailing edge of a rotor blade
related to the pressure side of a rotor blade
related to the suction side of a rotor blade

Double or plural piston ring arrangements, i.e. two or more piston rings
Glands for admission or removal of fluids from shafts

Mounting on supporting structures or systems

note.note-paragraph: Geometry indicates the shape or form of a component or the configuration or arrangement of components in a machine or in a plant

title-part.text: according to the direction of their main axis or their axis of rotation
the axes being parallel to each other
the axes being perpendicular to each other
the axes being inclined in relation to each other
the main axis being substantially vertical
in inner-outer relationship, e.g. shaft-bearing arrangements
augmenting, i.e. with intercepting fluid flow cross sectional area greater than the rest of the machine behind the inlet
concentrating only, i.e. with intercepting fluid flow cross sectional area not greater than the rest of the machine behind the inlet
given by a set or table of xyz-coordinates
given by its similarity to a letter, e.g. T-shaped
Size or power range of the machines

Fluid modulation at a certain frequency

by intercooling, e.g. during a compression cycle
by the provision of a heat exchanger within the cooling circuit

the driven magnets encircling the driver magnets

as a function of flow velocity
by turning around an axis parallel to the rotor centre line
by turning around an axis perpendicular the rotor centre line

the adjusting mechanism using auxiliary power sources
the adjusting mechanism driven or triggered by centrifugal forces
the adjusting mechanism driven or triggered by aerodynamic forces

Testing, e.g. methods, components or tools therefor
using aerodynamic forces, i.e. lift or drag
Functionality given by mechanical stress related aspects such as low cycle fatigue (LCF) of high cycle fatigue (HCF)
particularly aimed at mechanical or thermal stress reduction
Preventing, counteracting or reducing vibration or noise
by mistuning rotor blades or stator vanes with irregular interblade spacing, airfoil shape
Ignition, e.g. ignition by warming up of fuel or oxidizer in a resonant acoustic cavity
by keeping it below damagingly high values
by making it as high as possible
to affect the output of the engine
to match engine to driven device
in particular the electrical frequency of driven generator
with as little smoke as possible
with as little NOx as possible
of one engine in a multi-engine system
by temporary overriding set control limits
caused by water or hail ingestion
to cope with, or avoid, compressor flow instabilities
caused by working fluid flow velocity profile distortion
due to high angle of attack of aircraft
to maintain desired vehicle trajectory parameters
to control two or more engines simultaneously
to control thermoacoustic behaviour in the combustion chambers
to control water or steam injection
by a plasma generator, e.g. control of ignition
to optimize the performance of a machine
excessive temperatures, e.g. caused by overheating
of the auxiliary fluid for heating or cooling purposes
passive or reactive, e.g. using large wind vanes
by electrical means, e.g. relays or switches
by electronic means, e.g. electronic tubes, transistors or IC`s within an electronic circuit
by hydraulic means, e.g. hydraulic valves within a hydraulic circuit
by mechanical means, e.g. levers, gears or cams
synthesized, i.e. parameter computed by a mathematical model
Devices generating input signals, e.g. transducers, sensors, cameras or strain gauges

Hydrophilic, i.e. being or having wettable properties
Hydrophobic, i.e. being or having non-wettable properties
Properties or characteristics given to material by treatment or manufacturing
Orientation of fibres, weaving, ply angle
Syntactic materials, i.e. hollow spheres embedded in a matrix
